alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 7:53PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Grafton and central Carroll Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 752 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sandwich, or near Moultonborough, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Moultonborough, Ossipee, Holderness, Tamworth, Sandwich, Bartlett, Madison, Freedom, Center Harber, Albany, Waterville Valley, Thornton and Campton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Grafton
